outcome: With BCI records corrupted, multiple Council factions create their own public histories of Halden's final days. Competing narratives fracture public trust, sparking allegiance to rival versions of the 'truth.'

events.description: Multiple memorial announcements for Halden are released, each presenting different accounts of his last weeks. The public is uncertain which to believe.
The Council's security office issues a statement hinting at external interference in Halden's death. The Directorate quietly disputes this in internal channels.
A large-scale mural appears downtown displaying three major versions of Halden's legacy. Citizens gather to argue and pledge support to their chosen story.
Directorate members circulate old audio fragments allegedly of Halden voicing digital control concerns, framing the Innovators as reckless.
Rival propaganda floods social feeds. Citizens align behind different memories of Halden, splitting public unity and making BCI compliance more unpredictable.
